Description: Disk shaped mace-head of black and white diorite, with a slightly convex upper surface.
Curator's comments: Published: E. R. Ayrton & W. L. S. Loat, 'Pre-dynastic cemetery at El Mahasna' (London, 1911), 21, 33; pl. xx.3 lower right, viii.39. When found before the face of the man in the grave, the mace-head had remnants of its wooden handle preserved ( see Ayrton and Loat 1911,pl. viii.39). Two model mace heads of the same shape, made of clay, were found in the same tomb (see EA 49008, 49010). Grave H23 at Mahasna is significant for the number and variety of mace-heads it contained.
Bibliographic references: Shaw & Nicholson 1995 / British Museum Dictionary of Ancient Egypt (p167)
